title: Mana regeneration has been overnerfed.
body:
We have many different runes and all them are interesting, but mages are absolutely screwed if they don't pick Manaflow Band. 

I don't exactly get why a higher variety of runes is good when picking one of them is compulsory for a whole champion class. What's the point?

replies.body:
Manaflow Band is trash on almost every champ, ever since it was reworked from the old version - it restores < 1k mana over the course of an entire game.  Unlike ocean and most champ passives, the mana it restores is / 5 sec, instead of / sec.  It's basically a Faerie Charm in terms of what it restores - and that's being generous.

At best, it gives +250 max mana for champs like anivia and ryze who build arcangel's and scale with mana, but for most champs it is just bad.  I consider nimbus to be better in most situations since it will help you kite or chase after you've used your most damaging ability, and you're at your most vulnerable state, or even the magic shield vs an ap comp.

The sorcery tree in general is underwhelming, especially for mages.

TBH, as long as their kit is strong as a counterbalance, im completely fine with that.
Rather have power in the champ than in their runes.

250 mana is an aditional spell rotation, add in the regen and you can do nearly two more rotation than you could without it in a full fight.
it's not insane sustain, but it still makes quite a difference for many champs.
When Mages stop worrying about mana they have no downside.

Yes and there's absolutely nothing wrong with that.

Mages should have to manage their mana to be effective.
Why do they have to be the only one to do so? That's the problem. Other classes can do what they do, but they're the only class that has to watch the mana bar like they're still in lane phase.

In general, mages tend to have the most game-warping abilities (not always, but they do tend toward that direction), alongside tanks. Tanks are also generally not very friendly on their mana pools, and they shouldn't be. When you're packing abilities that can turn or define teamfights, you need to be on some sort of finite resource so you don't literally just spam it and make the entire game revolve around you. 

Normally I'm all for making mages interesting and helping them out since that was my pet role when I played, but removing a finite resource just because other champions don't have to deal with it is a poor way to balance mages.
